guidancePanel.title: Writing Tips
tips: Follow your plan from Section 4 - don't change structure midway
Use topic sentences to start each body paragraph
Include linking words (However, Furthermore, For instance)
Avoid contractions (don't → do not, can't → cannot)
Leave 5 minutes at the end to check for errors

sections.title: Check Your Essay
sections.description: Use this checklist to review your work

items.label: Introduction clearly paraphrases the question (not copied)
tips: Use synonyms: AI → artificial intelligence, replacing → substituting, workers → employees, human labor

items.label: Body paragraph 1 discusses advantages with clear topic sentence
tips: Topic sentence = first sentence stating main advantage

items.label: Body paragraph 2 discusses disadvantages equally
tips: Use transition: However, On the negative side, Despite these benefits

items.label: Conclusion summarizes both advantages and disadvantages
tips: Don't introduce new ideas in conclusion

items.label: Both advantages and disadvantages are discussed equally
tips: Count sentences - both sides should have similar length

items.label: Multiple points provided for each side
tips: Aim for at least 2-3 points per side

items.label: Specific examples are provided
tips: Real examples like specific industries or technologies are strongest

items.label: All parts of the question are fully addressed
No repeated words - synonyms used throughout
Topic vocabulary from Section 2 is used correctly
Complex sentences are used (not all simple sentences)
tips: Use: who, which, that, although, while, because

items.label: Verb tenses are consistent and correct

sections.title: Band 8 Model Answer
sections.description: Compare your essay with this high-band example

essay.fullEssay:
The growing prevalence of artificial intelligence in workplace automation has transformed numerous sectors, with machines increasingly performing tasks previously requiring human workers. While this technological advancement offers certain economic benefits, it also presents significant challenges for employment and social stability.

On the positive side, AI implementation dramatically increases productivity and reduces operational costs across industries. Automated systems operate continuously without requiring breaks, holidays, or salaries, while maintaining consistent quality and making fewer errors than human workers. For instance, manufacturing companies utilizing robotic assembly lines achieve round-the-clock production with superior precision and efficiency. Furthermore, AI eliminates dangerous and repetitive tasks, significantly improving workplace safety. Mining operations, for example, now deploy autonomous machines in hazardous environments that would endanger human workers, substantially reducing injuries and fatalities. These efficiency gains also drive innovation, freeing human workers to focus on creative and strategic activities that machines cannot replicate.

However, the disadvantages of widespread automation are substantial and alarming. Millions of workers in routine occupations face unemployment as AI systems replace their roles, creating economic hardship and social instability. Transportation workers, including truck drivers and taxi operators, confront imminent job displacement as autonomous vehicles develop rapidly. Moreover, the benefits of automation concentrate disproportionately among technology companies and their shareholders, exacerbating income inequality. Workers lacking technical skills find themselves increasingly marginalized in modern labor markets, while retraining opportunities remain inadequate. This technological disruption threatens entire communities economically dependent on industries vulnerable to automation.

In conclusion, while AI adoption delivers productivity improvements and safety benefits, its negative impacts on employment and economic equality are profound. Governments must urgently implement comprehensive retraining programs and social policies to manage this transition and protect vulnerable workers from the adverse consequences of automation.

strengths: Balanced discussion of both advantages and disadvantages
Clear organization with strong topic sentences
Wide range of vocabulary (prevalence, marginalized, exacerbating)
Complex sentence structures with varied grammar
